thread.title: Yeoman work: Canning's 242 yards, 4 TDs lift Lions to win
thread.title_full: Yeoman work: Canning's 242 yards, 4 TDs lift Lions to win

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Yeoman work: Canning's 242 yards, 4 TDs lift Lions to win
text:
Yeoman work: Canning's 242 yards, 4 TDs lift Lions to win Belfast proves too talented for Waterville Purple Panthers By Staff | Oct 12, 2015 
Belfast â€” With the ground-and-pound work of Alex Canning, the Belfast football team clicked on all cylinders Friday night, Oct. 9 en route to a convincing 45-8 home victory over Waterville on Dennis " Bear" Bryant Field. 
Canning carried the ball 10 times for 242 yards and four touchdowns in a yeoman effort for Lions against the visiting Purple Panthers (1-5). 
The hosts, who celebrated senior night, received contributions from a number of players in rolling to their third win, which evened their record. 
Belfast tallied 14 points in the first quarter, 18 more in the second and 13 in the fourth. The Purple Panthers scored eight points in the second and fourth stanzas. 
The Lions led 32-8 at halftime. 
Bryce Swisher added a 80-yard kick return for a touchdown and a 5-yard TD as well for the Lions. Additionally, Brandon Porter caught a 73-yard touchdown pass for the Lions. 
"Great win for us on senior night," said veteran Lion coach Chris Bartlett. "[The] guys came out right from the beginning and played very well. I am extremely happy and proud of our seniors. We still have work to do and will be getting at [it] next week. Foxcroft [Academy, the Lions' next opponent] is going to be a hard-hitting team that will play with a lot of pride and will play hard at their place. But, for tonight, it was all about the seniors. Great win for the whole team." 
Devon Begin rushed 10 times for 40 yards and Demetrius Ramirez had the lone touchdown and 83 yards receiving for the Purple Panthers. Isaac Pellerin finished 10-of-21 for 111 yards and a score, as well as one interception for Waterville. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Crabtree Point Standings for Class C North, Belfast (3-3, 106.2500 points) is fourth, while Winslow (6-0, 137.5000 points) is first in the 10-team region. The top eight squads qualify for the playoffs. Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
